TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridBoolColumn extends System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle

Docs.summary: Specifies a column in which each cell contains a check box for representing a Boolean value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> derives from the `abstract` class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle>. At run time, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> contains check boxes in each cell that have three states by default: checked (`true`), unchecked (`false`), and <xref:System.DBNull.Value>. To use two-state check boxes, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull%2A> property to `false`.
Properties added to the class include <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A>. These properties specify the value underlying each of the column's states.
## Examples The following code example first creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> and adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridColumnStylesCollection> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle>.
[!code-cpp[DataGridBoolColumn overview#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridBoolColumn overview/CPP/boolcolumn.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DataGridBoolColumn overview#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridBoolColumn overview/CS/boolcolumn.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DataGridBoolColumn overview#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridBoolColumn overview/VB/boolcolumn.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a with the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn> must be associated with a data source that contains <xref:System.Boolean> values.
To get a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>, first use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingContext> to return the appropriate <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase>. Then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.GetItemProperties%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> to return a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection>. Finally, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection.Item%2A> property of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection> to return the specific <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> for the column.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.GetItemProperties%2A> method to return a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> for a <xref:System.Data.DataTable>. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> for a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> is then used to create the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn>.
[!code-cpp[Classic DataGridBoolColumn.DataGridBoolColumn1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridBoolColumn.DataGridBoolColumn1 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic DataGridBoolColumn.DataGridBoolColumn1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridBoolColumn.DataGridBoolColumn1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridBoolColumn.DataGridBoolColumn1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridBoolColumn.DataGridBoolColumn1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether null values are allowed.
Docs.value: if null values are allowed, otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When this property is set to false, the check boxes in the column have only two states: checked (`true`) and unchecked (`false`).
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the typical implementation of this method (as described in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> class), the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.Edit%2A> method does not site a control for editing the cell value. Instead, a check box is drawn when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.Paint%2A> method is called.

Docs.param: The value that must fit in the cell.
Docs.summary: Gets the optimum width and height of a cell given a specific value to contain.
Docs.returns: A that contains the drawing information for the cell.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.GetPreferredSize%2A> method allows you to resize the column based on the value displayed. For example, if a cell contains an especially large value, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.GetPreferredSize%2A> method to return the optimum size of the cell based on the value. The optimum size takes into account not only the size of the string, but also the font used to display it.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the actual value used when setting the value of the column to .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can also specify what text will be displayed by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle.NullText%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.AllowNull%2A> property must be set to true to enter null values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A> properties determine the actual values pushed into the data source.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.TrueValue%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.FalseValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn.NullValue%2A> properties of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridBoolColumn>.
